page.title: 18Farming - Creca/Kirtlebridge
page.content: Most of the farms are mixed stock. There are two dairy farms in the area. Dairy cows are Holsteins or Freisians with a few Ayrshires. Beef cattle are Dairy breds crossed with Charolais, Limousin and Simmentals. A.I. is used but a Freisian bull is sometimes kept. Sheep are Suffolk cross, a few Dorset Horned, a flock of Freisland Milk sheep and a small flock of Jacobs. Grass is the main crop which is cut for silage and hay. Some barley is grown for stock feed. On the wholw the land is fertile grassland. There is some rough grazing near Kirtlebridge and wetlands near Quarry Park. The farms do not employ many outside workers, depending on the family.
